p:
The detailed information for each plot is shown in Table 1
26 . P. orientalis is mainly distributed in areas with an altitude of 200 m–600 m, on shady and sunny slopes
27 . Therefore, we selected 10 typical plots with altitudes ranging from 332 m to 562 m located on each slope aspect. Within each plot, four P. orientalis trees that were at least 90 years of age were selected for sampling. Two or three cores were taken from each tree at breast height (1.3 m) from different sections of the stem using a 5-mm increment borer (a total of 92 cores were collected). To prevent contamination from other carbon sources, the collected samples were stored in glass tubes.
